snippet: Russia’s newly inaugurated president, Vladimir V. Putin, will not attend a summit meeting of world leaders next week, the White House said on Wednesday.
abstract: Russia’s newly inaugurated president, Vladimir V Putin, will not attend a G-8 summit meeting of world leaders in Maryland, postponing until June the much-anticipated first meeting between Pres Obama and Putin as leaders of their respective countries; delay serves to underscore what appears to be a difficult start to their relationship.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and ELLEN BARRY
byline.contributor: Helene Cooper reported from Washington, and Ellen Barry from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: Russia’s newly inaugurated president, Vladimir V. Putin, will not attend a summit meeting of world leaders next week, the White House said on Wednesday.

headline.seo: White House Says Putin Will Skip G-8 Meeting at Camp David
headline.main: Putin to Skip Group of 8 Session, Delaying Postelection Meeting With Obama
headline.print_headline: Putin to Skip Group of 8 Session, Delaying Postelection Meeting With Obama
